alert.note: Alert for Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 12:06PM EST until February 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Portage River At Woodville affecting Sandusky and Wood Counties. Sandusky River At Tiffin affecting Seneca County. Blanchard River Near Findlay affecting Hancock County. For the Portage River...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sandusky River...including Tiffin...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blanchard River...including Findlay...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sandusky River At Tiffin. * WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Flooding occurs along the Sandusky River near Route 53 north of U.S. 224. Flood waters will also cause Township Road 131 to become impassable. In town Water Street, Front Street, and Davis Street are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 10.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 02/26/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1015 PM EST.
